text: Thomas C. Fletcher House is a historic home located at Hillsboro, Jefferson County, Missouri. It was built about 1850, and is a two-story, log dwelling with later frame additions. It sits on a limestone and concrete block foundation. It was the home of Thomas C. Fletcher, Missouri's first Republican governor and the first native-born Missourian elected governor. (includes 4 photographs from 1974) It was listed on the National Register of Historic Places in 1974. == References == Category:Log houses in the United States Category:Houses on the National Register of Historic Places in Missouri Category:Houses completed in 1850 Category:Buildings and structures in Jefferson County, Missouri Category:National Register of Historic Places in Jefferson County, Missouri
title: Thomas C. Fletcher House
